description: Erection of single storey rear extension (4.30m in depth, maximum height of 3.60m and eaves height of 2.70m)
decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated on the balance of probability that the height of the eaves of the proposed extension would not exceed 3 metres when measured from the ground level, in conflict with Paragraph A.1(i) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.

Scale Bar Issues - the 1:50 scale bars on Plans A01 and A02 do not measure to the stated distance of 4m (they measure 2.6m), and the annotated dimensions are also incorrect. Please check the plan scales and amend where necessary.Please note the requirements:Existing and Proposed Floor Plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of the entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. A scale bar is encouraged.Existing and Proposed Elevations at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work. A scale bar is encouraged.
